job_title: Physical Therapy/Rehab Aide in Pleasanton, CA
pros: Everyone is super nice and willing to teach you everything as long as you ask. PTO is nice, everyone cares about you. Good environment.
cons: Equipment is always Misplaced and/or Missing.
Could be very disorganized when scheduling

pros: I honestly cannot think of many pros besides location.
cons: Physicians run the show. They bypass middle management to get their way. ICU barely has core staff. Most are travelers due to conflict with CV surgery PAs. Senior Management is aware but turns a blind eye. There is no standard of care. No one follows policy. Rules change each day based on who is in charge in various units.

job_title: System Administrator in Palo Alto, CA
pros: Usually left alone by management Transit-friendly commute
cons: No career development or promotion opportunities Completely political environment If you aren’t in patient care you don’t exist

review_title: Great place to work at, low compensatio
pros: I love working in my department. Our providers are amazing, with smart and humble/personable doctors. Most of them prefer to be addressed by their first names or nicknames. The nurses in our unit are supportive and always willing to help, I consider a good amount of them to be my dearest friends.
cons: Low compensation compared to Stanford main hospital and surrounding hospitals in the area.

job_title: Certified Nursing Assistant CNA in Pleasanton, CA
pros:
Skills and Knowledge of advance techniques and machines
Job advancement
Mentorship
Networking ability
Teamwork
Overtime/Double time
cons: Schedule flexibility with self schedule (small issue)

job_title: Certified Pharmacy Technician in Placentia, CA
pros: Diverse work environment, steady hours, huge emphasis on patient safety and equality
cons: shifts are limited meaning hours are too

job_title: RN Labor and Delivery in Pleasanton, CA
pros: Great work place, love the staff
cons: None. Always accommodating to your schedule
